Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.job

Class SpherePackingUtils

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.mfsim.model.job.SpherePackingUtils
public class SpherePackingUtils extends Object
Utility class with static utility methods for determine the coordinates of spheres in various packing in a cuboid and in a globe, respectively.
Author:
Mirco Daniel

  • Method Details

    • particleCoordinatesSimpleCubicInCuboid

      public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] particleCoordinatesSimpleCubicInCuboid(double rParticle, double xCuboid, double yCuboid, double zCuboid)
      Determine the x-, y- and z-coordinates of the particles (midpoints), which are packed in simple cubic (sc) in a cuboid
      Parameters:
      rParticle - : radius of particle
      xCuboid - : width of cuboid
      yCuboid - : length of cuboid
      zCuboid - : height of cuboid
      Returns:
      x-, y- and z-coordinates of particles in cuboid

    • particleCoordinatesSimpleCubicInCuboid

      Returns:
      x-, y- and z-coordinates of particles in cuboid

    • particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInCuboid

      public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInCuboid(double rParticle, double xCuboid, double yCuboid, double zCuboid)
      Determine the x-, y- and z-coordinates of the spheres (midpoints), which are packed in hexagonal close (hcp) in a cuboid. This method do not consider whether the result packing is a solution with best available with most spheres in the cuboid.
      Parameters:
      rParticle - : Radius of the spheres
      xCuboid - : Width of the cuboid
      yCuboid - : Length of the cuboid
      zCuboid - : Height of the cuboid
      Returns:
      x-, y- and z-coordinates of the particles in the cuboid

    • particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInCuboid

      public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInCuboid(double rParticle, double xCuboid, double yCuboid, double zCuboid, de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace startVector)
      Overloaded method
      Parameters:
      rParticle - : Radius of particle
      xCuboid - : Width of cuboid
      yCuboid - : Length of cuboid
      zCuboid - : Height of cuboid
      startVector - : Start vector
      Returns:
      Coordinates of particles

    • particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInSphere

      public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInSphere(double rParticle, double rSphere)
      Determine the x-, y- and z-coordinates of the spheres (midpoints), which are packed in hexagonal close (hcp) in a globe. This method do not consider whether the result packing is a solution with best available with most spheres in the globe.
      Parameters:
      rParticle - radius of the sphere
      rSphere - radius of sphere
      Returns:
      x-, y- and z-coordinates of the particles in globe

    • particleCoordinatesHexagonalCloseInSphere

      public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] particleCoordinatesFaceCenteredCubicInCuboid(double rParticle, double xCuboid, double yCuboid, double zCuboid)
      Determine the x-, y- and z-coordinates of particle (midpoints), which are packed in face-centered close (fcc) in a cuboid. This method do not consider whether the result packing is a solution with best available with most particles in the cuboid.
      Parameters:
      rParticle - : radius of particle
      xCuboid - width of cuboid
      yCuboid - length of cuboid
      zCuboid - height of cuboid
      Returns:
      x-, y- and z-coordinates of spheres in the cuboid

    • particleCoordinatesFaceCenteredCubicInSphere

      public de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace[] particleCoordinatesFaceCenteredCubicInSphere(double rParticle, double rSphere)
      Determine the x-, y- and z-coordinates of the particles (midpoints), which are packed in face centered close (fcc) in a sphere. This method do not consider whether the result packing is a solution with best available with most particles in the sphere.
      Parameters:
      rParticle - Radius of the particle
      rSphere - Radius of the sphere
      Returns:
      x-, y- and z-coordinates of the particles in the sphere
